title: Vector Representation
text: Since the function has an input that is denoted as three dimensional from the $$R^3$$ on the left of the arrow, it means that the $$x$$ vector has three components.

title: Distance
text: To find the distance between two vectors, subtract the corresponding components and square their difference. Then, take the square root of the sum of all the squared component differences.

title: Function Variables
text: The function will be written in terms of the components of $$x$$, which are kept as variables. Treat the components of the $$x$$ vector as if they were numerals when plugging into the distance formula.

title: Vector Representing a Plane
text: Since a plane is two dimensional, there are two components that are variables.

title: Third Component
text: The third component for a plane is kept as a constant, and is specified as $$x_3=0$$ in the problem.
